Mobiles.Name: knight reknown
Mobiles.Long_Description: A knight of reknown slaps you with his gauntlet and challenges you!
Mobiles.Description:
The knight of reknown is mounted on a warhorse, uses a lance, and you can 
see his morningstar on his horse. His colors fly from a banner carried by 
his squire.

Mobiles.Name: squire
Mobiles.Long_Description: A squire is here on an errand for his lord.
Mobiles.Description:
A squire stands here on a mission for his lord. He is dressed in rags, 
smells bad, and looks like he is in a hurry.

Mobiles.Name: knight quality
Mobiles.Long_Description: A knight of quality looks down upon you from his mount.
Mobiles.Description: The knight is in full plate mail on a barded horse and carries a lance.

Mobiles.Name: arthur king
Mobiles.Long_Description: King Arthur sits upon his throne awaiting the return of the grail.
Mobiles.Description:
King Arthur is a black bearded barrel chested man. He is in full plate 
armor emblazoned with the sign of a gold dragon. He carries Excalibur 
in a strange looking sheath.

Mobiles.Name: benlad knight green
Mobiles.Short_Description: Sir Benlad de Haudtesert (the green knight)
Mobiles.Long_Description: Sir Benlad slaps you with his gauntlet and challenges you!
Mobiles.Description:
Sir Benlad is clad in his renowned green armor, rumored to be impervious 
to normal weaponry. He bears a huge battle axe.

Mobiles.Name: galahad knight
Mobiles.Long_Description: Sir Galahad, paragon of chivalry, bastard of Lancelot & Elane, stands here.
Mobiles.Description:
Sir Galahad is dressed in his white armor and carries a two handed sword
(it was Sir Galahad who completed the quest for the grail in the Arthurian 
saga)

Mobiles.Name: black knight
Mobiles.Long_Description: A knight dressed in black armor says "NONE SHALL PASS"
Mobiles.Description:
The black knight has black armor and a visored helm. He stands resting on 
a two handed sword.

Mobiles.Name: gareth knight
Mobiles.Long_Description: A knight with armor of many colors stands here.
Mobiles.Description:
Sir Gareth, son of Lot, aka Beaumains proudly wears his armor and shield 
of many colors. He anxiously awaits an opportunity to help a damsel in 
distress.

Mobiles.Name: garlon knight
Mobiles.Long_Description: Sir Garlon, the invisible knight, is waiting here.
Mobiles.Description:
Sir Garlon (the vile villian) is hiding here. He was given his invisibility 
power by the witch of the fens for the furtherment of evil.

Mobiles.Name: gawaine knight
Mobiles.Long_Description: Sir Gawaine, the strong, is on a mission of vengeance!
Mobiles.Description:
Sir Gawaine, the red headed cousin of Arthur, is mounted, fully armored and 
bears his longsword Galantine.

Mobiles.Name: lamorak knight
Mobiles.Long_Description: Sir Lamorak hefts his bastard sword as he considers you.
Mobiles.Description:
Sir Lamorak, son of King Pellinore, lover of Queen Morgawse, vanquisher of 
the twelve of Morgan le Fey, and enemy of Sir Gawaine is fully armored and 
mounted.

Mobiles.Name: lancelot knight
Mobiles.Long_Description: Sir Lancelot, champion of the Round Table, smiles at you.
Mobiles.Description:
Sir Lancelot is mounted upon a white charger and is wearing polished steel 
armor. His visor is up, and his lance raised in salute to you.

Mobiles.Name: merlin mage
Mobiles.Long_Description: The mighty Merlin is here grumbling over a book.
Mobiles.Description:
Merlin, the son of a sorceress and a demon, seer of Camelot, is garbed in 
an earthy colored robe and bears a twisted staff. His flowing white beard 
offsets his rosy cheeks and sparkling blue eyes.

Mobiles.Name: le fey mage
Mobiles.Long_Description: A beautiful woman with an inviting smile beckons to you!
Mobiles.Description:
Morgan le Fey, evil enchantress, scourge of Camelot, snarls as you have 
seen through her disguise. She is wearing silk robes which do little to 
hide her ugly and hateful, twisted body.

Mobiles.Name: pellinore king
Mobiles.Long_Description: King Pellinore is here searching for the Questing Beast.
Mobiles.Description:
King Pellinore tells you that his family has been searching for the Questing
Beast for generations and asks if you have seen it. Pelinore is just past 
middle age, though he is still a stout fighter.

Mobiles.Name: beast questing
Mobiles.Long_Description: A long necked, lion pawed, spotted, creature is here knawing on a femur.
Mobiles.Description:
The Questing Beast hits you Supernaturally Hard !!!
The Questing Beast hits you Supernaturally Hard !!!
The Questing Beast dodges your attack.
You sure are BLEEDING!
The Questing Beast is in perfect health.

Mobiles.Name: tristram
Mobiles.Long_Description: Sir Tristram smirks at you.
Mobiles.Description:
Sir Tristram, suitor of Isolade, is considered by many to be second only to
Lancelot in skill of arms. He wears plate mail and carries a two handed 
sword.

Mobiles.Name: mordred
Mobiles.Long_Description: An boy in golden armor gives you an elfin laugh and strikes with his spear!
Mobiles.Description:
Mordred, bastard son of Lancelot and Gwenivere, wears his enchanted golden 
armor and his unholy spear.

Mobiles.Name: charmed knight reknown
Mobiles.Long_Description: A charmed knight of reknown woodenly attacks you!
Mobiles.Description:
The knight is in rusty armor and bears a knotched sword. He has a disheveled 
look to him and his eyes stare vacantly at you!

Mobiles.Name: charmed knight quality
Mobiles.Long_Description: A charmed knight of quality woodenly attacks you!
Mobiles.Description:
A charmed knight of quality stands here in his rusted armor. His eyes are 
vacant, his sword is knotched, and he is unkempt.

Mobiles.Name: lady waiting
Mobiles.Long_Description: A lady in waiting bats her eyes at you!
Mobiles.Description:
The lady in waiting snuggles up closer to you, pressing you for the details 
of your last campaign. She is clad in a long gown and garlands of flowers 
are in her hair.

Mobiles.Name: queen gwenivere
Mobiles.Long_Description: A raven haired queen winks at you from behind her fan.
Mobiles.Description: Gwenivere tells you a sorry tale about her forbidden love with Lancelot.

Mobiles.Name: squire charmed
Mobiles.Long_Description: A charmed squire stands here woodenly
Mobiles.Description: The charmed squire is wearing various leather garmets in a state of disarray.

Mobiles.Name: barant king apres knight
Mobiles.Short_Description: Barant Les Apres (King of the Hundred Knights)
Mobiles.Long_Description: A knight in a flowing white cape and swings a spiked ball here.
Mobiles.Description:
Barant Les Apres, King of the Hundred Knights stands here. Barant wears a 
white cape and carries a spiked ball and chain. He hefts his weapon and 
grins at you.

Mobiles.Name: dagonet jester fool
Mobiles.Long_Description: A fool in motley cavorts here!
Mobiles.Description:
Dagonet, the court jester of Arthur, is a master of his craft. He dances 
on his hands while juggling a set of knives. You get the impression that 
he could handle himself well in a fight.

Mobiles.Name: turquine knight
Mobiles.Long_Description: A knight with a wolf helm cackles with glee!
Mobiles.Description:
Turquine is dressed in scale mail and a wolf helm. He is a slender whip 
of a man, and his eyes dart left and right.

Mobiles.Name: perimones knight
Mobiles.Long_Description: A knight dressed red shimmering armor faces you!
Mobiles.Description:
Perimones, the red knight, has a red beard and mustache. He is a short 
stocky man. His ruby armor is shimmering in the sunlight, and he wears 
the silken red favor of Galenvine on his sleeve.

Mobiles.Name: damsel lady woman distress
Mobiles.Long_Description: A damsel in distress is here, screaming for help!
Mobiles.Description:
The damsel in distress has been badly roughed up by the ruffians. She is 
tied with here hands behind her back. Her coartly gowns are soiled and 
tattered.

Mobiles.Name: nobleman
Mobiles.Long_Description: A nobleman stands here in all his finery.
Mobiles.Description:
The nobleman wears the finest cotton and wool clothing available. Riches 
adorn him in the form of chains, and a rather heavy looking purse. He 
seems intent on going somewhere.

Mobiles.Name: serf
Mobiles.Long_Description: A dirty serf shuffles along here.
Mobiles.Description: The serf is in rags, smells, and you actually think you can see lice on him.

Mobiles.Name: merchant
Mobiles.Long_Description: A brightly clothed merchant hawks his goods to you!
Mobiles.Description: The merchant wears a bright tunic to draw attention and signify his wares.

Mobiles.Name: monk
Mobiles.Long_Description: A monk is here in his mumbling in Latin here.
Mobiles.Description:
The monk has a brown robe with a hood on it. He has tied it off with a 
piece of rope. The top of his head is shaved in the Fransician fashion.

Mobiles.Name: troubadour
Mobiles.Long_Description: A troubadour is here, strumming a merry tune.
Mobiles.Description: The troubadour is playing on a mandolin, and is dressed in festival colors.

Mobiles.Name: bard
Mobiles.Long_Description: A bard is here, singing a sweet ballad.
Mobiles.Description:
The bard is dressed in silk leggings, a leather vest, and bright orange 
shirt.

Mobiles.Name: entertainer
Mobiles.Long_Description: An entertainer is here, leaping with great acrobatic prowess!
Mobiles.Description: The entertainer is doing handsprings and backflips in a dizzying progression.

Mobiles.Name: servant
Mobiles.Long_Description: A servant is rushing by
Mobiles.Description: The servant has a plate of hot food that looks delicious.

Mobiles.Name: demon
Mobiles.Long_Description: A towering, black scaled demon has come to eat your soul!
Mobiles.Description:
The demon stands 20' tall, has two heads, black scales, a mouthfull of 
sharp teeth, 4 arms with long razorlike claws, and two muscular legs 
with cloven hooves. The heads are batlike, and the black eyes seem to 
vacantly stare at you. As it breathes the ground you stand on rumbles, 
and you are seared by its hot breath. It is this demon which has been 
laughing at you in all your visions. Merlin has bound this demon here 
to use its power in the fabrication of magic items, however his hold 
has slipped a few times, enabling the demon to give out a few artifacts 
to encourage the downfall of Camelot (Morgana, Pict leader).

Mobiles.Name: jack iron
Mobiles.Long_Description: Iron Jack, the armorer of Camelot is here.
Mobiles.Description:
Iron Jack wears his smith apron, leather leggings, and has corded muscular 
arms.

Mobiles.Name: stirrup stablemaster
Mobiles.Long_Description: Stirrup, the stable master of Camelot is here.
Mobiles.Description: Stirrup is a short man, wearing a leather jerkin, and smells of the barn.

Mobiles.Name: horse riding
Mobiles.Long_Description: A riding horse is here.
Mobiles.Description:
The riding horse is saddled with light tack, and has long slender limbs 
for speed.

Mobiles.Name: warhorse medium
Mobiles.Long_Description: A medium warhorse is tethered here.
Mobiles.Description: The medium warhorse is has heavy tack and leather barding.

Mobiles.Name: warhorse heavy
Mobiles.Long_Description: A heavy warhorse paws the ground and snorts in preparation for battle!
Mobiles.Description: The heavy warhorse has full chain barding and stands 17 hands.

Mobiles.Name: raider saxon
Mobiles.Long_Description: A Saxon raider is here, ready to take your head as a trophy
Mobiles.Description:
The Saxon raider carries his sax, *yes really it is an actual weapon name*, 
and is dressed in various hides.

Mobiles.Name: slave
Mobiles.Long_Description: A slave is here, cringing from battle.
Mobiles.Description:
The slave is dirty and unkempt, but she retains a vestage of her former 
station and bearing.

Mobiles.Name: chief saxon render
Mobiles.Long_Description: A Saxon chief is here, leading his raiders into battle!
Mobiles.Description:
The Saxon chief, Render (you know his name because of the general grunting), 
is decked in the spoils of war. All and all you think he has lice.

Mobiles.Name: guard border northern
Mobiles.Long_Description: A northern border guard is here, stoically holding the line against intruders.
Mobiles.Description: The border guard wears chain armor and is equipped with a standard sword.

Mobiles.Name: commander outpost
Mobiles.Long_Description: The northern outpost commander is here, safe in the respect of his men.
Mobiles.Description:
The outpost commander is a hardened, grizzled veteran with the cunning that 
comes from a life of leading men in endless battle.

Mobiles.Name: clansman scot
Mobiles.Long_Description: A Scot clansman is here, ready to seize your women and whiskey!
Mobiles.Description:
The Scot clansman is wearing a kilt, leather sandles, and has a long swath 
of cloth wrapped around his shoulders. He carries a beautiful claymore which 
is about 4' long.

Mobiles.Name: chief clan scot
Mobiles.Long_Description: The Scot clan chief is here, seizing his clansman's women and whiskey!
Mobiles.Description:
The Scot clan chief towers over you. He looks like he could toss a tree end 
over end and have it land pointing away from him. He looks like he could 
heave a sheaf with a fork more than 20' in the air. He looks like he could 
down a barrel of ale and still have his whiskey. He looks...

Mobiles.Name: serf busy
Mobiles.Long_Description: A busy serf is here, tilling the fields for harvest.
Mobiles.Description: The serf has a farm tool and a rag to cover himself.

Mobiles.Name: raider angle
Mobiles.Long_Description: An Angle raider is here, burning huts and raping women!
Mobiles.Description:
The Angle raider is tall, blond haired, and wears a horned helmet. He 
carries a shield and his Angle, an angled swordlike blade. He is in partial 
leather armor.

Mobiles.Name: chief angle
Mobiles.Long_Description: The Angle chief is here, leading the massacre!
Mobiles.Description:
The Angle chief is a giant of a man, covered in blood, and laughing with 
a deep boom at each kill.

Mobiles.Name: calvary unit
Mobiles.Long_Description: A calvary unit is here, flanking the enemy lines.
Mobiles.Description: The calvary unit consists of about 30 mounted knights on medium warhorses.

Mobiles.Name: infantry unit
Mobiles.Long_Description: An infantry unit is here, fighting the Pict hoards.
Mobiles.Description: The infantry unit has about 50 squires and serfs armed with polearms.

Mobiles.Name: hoard pict picts
Mobiles.Long_Description: A hoard of Picts is here, fighting the troops of Camelot.
Mobiles.Description:
The hoard of Picts consists of about 500 poorly armed and armored foot 
soldiers.

Mobiles.Name: leader pict
Mobiles.Long_Description: The Pict leader is here, retreating from battle.
Mobiles.Description:
The Pict leader is covered in blue dye, giving him a fearsome demonic 
appearance which is further augmented by his reindeer horned helmet.

Mobiles.Name: persante knight
Mobiles.Long_Description: Persante of Inde is here, marshalling the troops of Camelot.
Mobiles.Description:
Persante is called the blue knight because of his brilliant blue armor. 
He is mounted on a fine charger, and is waving his blue pennant.

Mobiles.Name: dodinas knight
Mobiles.Long_Description: Dodinas le Savage is here, holding the center of the line!
Mobiles.Description:
Dodinas is a whirlwind of weapons and martial skill, felling all who
approach. He is mounted atop his famed steed Rue.

Mobiles.Name: lionel knight
Mobiles.Long_Description: Lionel is here, unhorsed, and fighting for his life!
Mobiles.Description:
Lionel is covered in blood, and is walking as if stunned. It looks like he 
is going to fall.

Mobiles.Name: gaheris knight
Mobiles.Long_Description: Gaheris (Gawaine's brother) is here putting down the raiders.
Mobiles.Description:
Gaheris has long red hair, and a gray stallion. He is extremely angry with 
the Angles and is cutting his way to the chief.

Mobiles.Name: commander outpost southern
Mobiles.Long_Description: The southern outpost commander is here, safe in the respect of his men.
Mobiles.Description:
The outpost commander is a hardened, grizzled veteran with the cunning that 
comes from a life of leading men in endless battle.

Mobiles.Name: guard border southern
Mobiles.Long_Description: A southern border guard is here, stoically holding the line against intruders.
Mobiles.Description: The border guard wears chain armor and is equipped with a standard sword.

Mobiles.Name: slave
Mobiles.Long_Description: A slave is here, cringing from battle.
Mobiles.Description:
The slave is dirty and unkempt, but she retains a vestage of her former 
station and bearing.

Objects.Name: dagger squire
Objects.Description: A leather hilted dagger lies here.

Objects.Name: mace knight knight's
Objects.Description: A clublike weapon with a spiked balled head lies here.

Objects.Name: lance knight knight's
Objects.Description: An 18' pole is sunk into the ground here.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: This pole looks alot like a lance.

Objects.Name: armor green
Objects.Description: A fine suit of green armor bearing the crest of Hautdesert glistens here!

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: The crest has a stag on a verdant field

Objects.Name: axe benlad benlad's
Objects.Description: A two headed axe with the Hautdesert crest lies here.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: The crest has a stag on a verdant field

Objects.Name: bracer white
Objects.Description: A humming, blinding white bracer lies here!

Objects.Name: grail holy
Objects.Description: A beat-up, dirty, wooden cup lies here.

Objects.Name: cloak many orkney
Objects.Description: A cloak of many colors and the crest of Orkney lies here.

Objects.Name: shield
Objects.Description: A rainbow of colors is reflected from the shield which lies here!

Objects.Name: sword excalibur
Objects.Description: A beautiful dragon hilted sword lies here!

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
You run your fingers over the blue green steel of Excalibur, and you feel 
a tingling sensation. Your vison blurs until all you see is a blinding 
white light. A warm sensation fills your limbs, and a sense of relaxed 
comfort permeates you. A deep fatherlike voice says "Now that Arthur is 
dead, it is up to you to right what he wrought. Seek out and destroy Mordred 
and Morgan Le Fey. They are destroying Camelot." The voice and the light 
gradually fade leaving you with only a lingering warm feeling.

Objects.Name: scabbard arthur arthur's golden
Objects.Description: A beautiful golden scabbard lies here!

Objects.Name: armband armbands garlon garlon's
Objects.Description: A set of armbands of black iron lie here.

Objects.Name: helm horned gawaine gawaine's
Objects.Description: A burnished steel helm with oxen horns lies here.

Objects.Name: spurs silver lamorak lamorak's
Objects.Description: A set of silver spurs lies here.

Objects.Name: gauntlets bravery
Objects.Description: A glowing pair of burnished chain mesh gauntlets lies here.

Objects.Name: ring incubus crest gold
Objects.Description: A ring of twisted red gold bearing the likeness of an Incubus lies here.

Objects.Name: staff merlin merlin's
Objects.Description: A staff of two intertwined vines lies here in a circle of power!

Objects.Name: greaves blackened steel
Objects.Short_Description: a pair of blackened steel greaves
Objects.Description: A pair of blackened steel greaves lies here. There is an inscription on them.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
You look at the inscription. It reads "I do hereby swear to not reveal my 
crest until I have stopped all from entering Camelot for a period of 5 years, 
as I have promised Morgana in exchange for the favor of Eveline"

Objects.Name: wand rod
Objects.Short_Description: a marble rod with a white hot tip
Objects.Description: A marble rod with a white hot tip is smouldering here.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
As you examine the wand, you get a funny feeling. It swells into a vision of 
the previous's wands owner, Morgan Le Fey. You hear a cackling laughter and 
red eyes bore into your head. As the vison fades you hear the message '
...with each charmed, your soul belongs a little more to me...'.

Objects.Name: pack backpack trailpack leather pellinore pellinore's
Objects.Description: A backpack made of fine leather sits here. You see lettering on its corner.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
You read the writing on the pack. It says "To my dear friend Pellinore, may 
this pack make your journeys shorter and allow you to bring all the 
provisions you need. Simply wear the pack, and and the weight and number 
of items you carry will increase, and you will be able to travel long 
distances without tiring. I have made this pack lockable (use the key with 
the letter P). May you succeed in your quest!     - Merlin".

Objects.Name: key p letter
Objects.Short_Description: a key with the letter "P" on it
Objects.Description: A key with the letter "P" on it is here.

Objects.Name: rations trail
Objects.Description: Some trail rations (nuts, dried fuits, dried meats) are here.

Objects.Name: flask wine
Objects.Short_Description: a flask of a nice red wine
Objects.Description: A flask of nice, cold Pinot Noir wine is here, just waiting to be tasted.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: The wine is a beautiful deep red in color, and it goes well with all food.

Objects.Name: bones bone pile
Objects.Description: A pile of bones lies here.

Objects.Name: skull human
Objects.Description: A human skull lies here.

Objects.Name: rock black small
Objects.Description: A small black rock lies here.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
Persistant, huh? Well yes it seems like that mage buddy of yours once was 
talking about rune wafers that could be eaten and have magical effects 
happen. This looks like one of those.

You look at the rock. On the rock are carved strange rune symbols that you 
don't understand. The rock has blood on it.

Objects.Name: letter love
Objects.Description: A love letter addressed to Tristram is rolled and sealed with a wax emblem.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
You break the seal and look at the letter. The letter reads:

My beloved Tristram. How much do I long for your gentle presence alongside 
me! My father seethes at the very thought of you. Beware! He seeks to do you 
harm. I have spoken with Merlin and heas bewitched this letter to allow you 
to fly invisibly to me, and pass unhindered through all our doors! Tarry not 
for I shall burst!

Forever and totally in your thrall,

Isolde
The seal bears the crest of the house of King Mark.

Objects.Name: armor golden
Objects.Description: A suit of golden armor shines here.

Objects.Name: spear unholy
Objects.Short_Description: a spear glowing in an unholy dark light
Objects.Description: A spear is here, glowing with an unholy dark light.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
You look at the unholy light surrounding the spear. Your vision darkens. 
Out of the darkness red glowing eyes laugh and dance at you. A rage slowly 
fills you, you want to kill. Rend. Tear. Rape. Murder - ahhahahahah!

Objects.Name: favor silken
Objects.Description: A silken favor is here. Maybe it belongs to your lady?

Objects.Name: necklace
Objects.Description: An exquisite emerald necklace has been left here!

Objects.Name: ball chain
Objects.Short_Description: a massive spiked ball and chain
Objects.Description: A massive spiked iron ball attached to a iron handle by a 3' chain is here.

Objects.Name: motley fool fools
Objects.Description: Some fool has left his motley here.

Objects.Name: helm wolf helmet
Objects.Description: A helm with the semblance of a wolf is here.

Objects.Name: armor shimmering red
Objects.Short_Description: a suit of shimmering red armor
Objects.Description: A suit of shimmering red armor glistens in the sunlight.

Objects.Name: key rusty
Objects.Description: A key is here, lying in the dirt, rusting.

Objects.Name: reward
Objects.Description: A deed of payment for the rescue of a damsel in distress is here.

Objects.Name: key room
Objects.Description: A brass key made depicting a young girl is here.

Objects.Name: purse heavy
Objects.Description: A rather heavy looking purse is here.

Objects.Name: cloak lice infested
Objects.Description: A lice infested cloak made of the skin of some animal is here.

Objects.Name: sword broad steel commander commander's
Objects.Description: A commanders steel broad sword catches your eye.

Objects.Name: skin whiskey
Objects.Description: A skin smelling of whiskey is here, on the ground.

Objects.Name: ship dragon
Objects.Description: A dragon ship is beached here- where are those Angle raiders?

Objects.Name: angle
Objects.Description: An angle is here. A raider must be nearby.

Objects.Name: rod command
Objects.Description: A rod of black, runed metal swallows light here.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
You look at the metal rod, and a sick feeling comes over you. Your vision 
dims and you see two hot red eyes cutting though you. A demonic cackle 
sends chills down your spine, and as it fades you hear " with every use, 
you become mine..."

Objects.Name: banner war persante blue
Objects.Short_Description: the blue war banner of Persante of Inde
Objects.Description: The blue war banner of Persante of Inde lies here. Persante has fallen!

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: The banner depicts a Griffon on a pale blue sky

Objects.Name: lifecutter
Objects.Description: A blue black crusader hilt sword is stuck in the ground.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
As you look at the sword, you hear inside your head the words "My name is
Lifecutter, and my last master was Dodinas le Savage. Take me and lets 
slay evil!

Objects.Name: armor plate full
Objects.Short_Description: a suit of full plate armor
Objects.Description: A suit of full plate armor gleams on the ground.

Objects.Name: axe
Objects.Description: An enormous axe is resting here.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: The axe handle has the name 'Gaheris' inscibed on it.

Objects.Name: hat top black Lok Lok's
Objects.Description: Lok's black top hat is here- maybe you should give it to him- nah.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: Inscribed in the hatband is the message 'I belong to Lok'

Rooms.Name: Before the Forest Arden
Rooms.Description:
Before you stretches the vast forest Arden, consisting of towering oaks 
and unknown wildlife. A path leads northwards into the forest. There is a 
piece parchment nailed to an old oak, and a guilded plaque is affixed to a 
boulder.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
Camelot 1994 by Lok- There are lots of extras, so be sure to look at 
keywords in rooms and at your objects to get the full picture of the 
area. As with all bards of the round table, I have altered story elements 
to suit my whim.

The parchment reads:

Let it be known that Arthur, King of the Britains seeks to form the company 
of the Round Table. All knights of valor and virtue are summoned to this 
august company in Camelot.

Rooms.Name: The Crossroads of Arden
Rooms.Description:
You stand at the crossroads of two dusty paths. Dappled sunlight lights 
the intersection and you notice horsesign in the dirt. The path continues 
in the north, south, east and west directions.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
You look carefully at the dirt and notice in addition to the horsesign, 
there is a trail of strange claw marks heading to the west.

You bend down and look at the hoofprints. The main traffic leads down the 
easterly path and southerly path.

Rooms.Name: The Forest Arden
Rooms.Description:
You are on a path in the great forest Arden. Boy you wish there wern't 
so many of those pesky knats. The trail leads south and east.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: They sure are pesky!

Rooms.Name: Trail of Bones
Rooms.Description:
The trail narrows and darkens and you notice a crunching sound. You look 
down-BONES! The trail darkens to the west and lightens to the north.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
You look at the bones. Most of them are human. You notice a beat up crest 
of the house Pellinore. There bones get deeper to the west.

Rooms.Name: A Hut in Forest Arden
Rooms.Description:
You stand before a weathered thatch hut. There are weeds everywhere-
obviously this place has been abandoned for some time. The door to the 
hut lies to the west and a dirty trail leads south.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
You get down on your hands and knees and examine the weeds. Most of them 
are herbs of one variety or another, and there is a tremendous variety of 
them.

Rooms.Name: A Fork in the Dirty Trail
Rooms.Description:
You are at a fork in the dirty trail in Forest Arden. There is horsesign 
in the dirt, and the trail goes north, east, and west from here.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
You bend down and look at the hoof marks in the dirt. The heavy traffic 
goes to the north and west.

Rooms.Name: Lair of the Questing Beast
Rooms.Description:
You have found the lair of the questing beast! Bones are strewn everywhere.
The only exit is to the east.

Rooms.Name: Inside a Hut
Rooms.Description:
You stand inside an old, abandonned hut. The ceiling is low, and the 
rafters are covered in soot. There is a workbench and an old fireplace.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: You examine the yellow stains. They smell of sulfur.
The rafters are darkened by smoke and strange yellow stains.

You pull out a torn scrap of paper. It says: Merlin, my love for Tristram 
is bountiless, yet my father forbids him to see me. Is there anything you 
can do?

Isolde

The fire has long since died out. All you see are old scraps of paper and 
wood in the fireplace.

The workbench is covered in glass tubing and vials of various colored 
liquids. Maybe you should leave it alone.

Rooms.Name: Mists of Arden
Rooms.Description:
You have steadily travelled downhill into a misty forested area. The tall 
black silhoettes of the towering oaks crowd your limited vision. You squint 
at the dirty trail which leads north and south and notice horsesign.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: You look at the horsesign and see that many horses have travelled this path.

Rooms.Name: Deep Woods
Rooms.Description:
You are in a deeply wooded section of the forest Arden. Shadows lengthen 
and play in the breeze. The trail continues north, east, and west.

Rooms.Name: Cursed Glade
Rooms.Description:
You have entered a glade where all the vegetation is dead. There is no 
sounds of wildlife, and no light reaches here from above. There are bones 
from previous visitors scattered about the glade. Maybe you should rest 
for a while

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: Maybe you should rest a while...

Rooms.Name: Dark Hollow
Rooms.Description:
You have entered a dark hollow. The air is heavy, damp and oppressive 
broken only bye the cackling of a crow. To the west is a dusty trail.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: Or was that a snicker?

Rooms.Name: The Forest Arden
Rooms.Description:
You have entered a bright and cheerful section of the Forest Arden. 
Squirrels chase one and another around the ancient oaks, and butterfiles 
dance in the dappled sunshine. The air smells sweet, the sun is on your 
back, and the horsetrodden trail leads north, south, and east.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: You discover horsesign. Most of the traffic heads east and south.
Yes, they are mating.

Rooms.Name: A Creek in the Forest Arden
Rooms.Description:
You have stopped for water at a little creek which cuts across the trail. 
To the south the forest brightens. To the west the forest darkens. The 
sky is blue and the sunlight flashes off the silvery waters.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
You stoop down to peer at the shiny flashy creek and see submerged a knight.
The knight bears the crest of Camelot and appears to have been coldly 
speared through the back.

Rooms.Name: Battleplain of Arden
Rooms.Description:
Before you stretches the grizzly battleplain of Arden. Countless centuries 
of war have littered the plain with bones and broken weapons of its 
combattants. There are signs of a recent carnage with several knights 
and their steeds lying in twisted heaps. A dirty trail continues to the 
west and east, and a winding road heads north.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: The sight sickens you.

Rooms.Name: Before Blackmoor
Rooms.Description:
You stand before Blackmoor the keep of the evil Mordred. The curtain wall 
is some 25 feet high and towers flank the gate and corners. The breeze 
brings a high pitched girlish laughter to you sending chills up your spine. 
To the north lies the black iron gates of Blackmoor, and to the south 
stretches a winding road.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: Actually they look like damned souls to you.

The great iron gates have been forged from pig iron, and they are strangly  
without rust. The iron spirals with great craftsmanship, forming into faces 
of distorted humans.

Rooms.Name: Forest Blackmoor
Rooms.Description:
You have entered Blackmoor, the forest of the damned. Thorns and crooked 
trees scratch and tear at you, almost as if they were alive. The well worn 
path has has vanished and you have lost your bearings.

Rooms.Name: Before an Inviting Hut
Rooms.Description:
You stand in front of an inviting hut. Smoke curls from the chimney 
bringing you the smell of fresh venison. Lamplight cuts through the 
darkness and the windows. A delightful song can be heard from inside. 
To the west is the door (adjar) to the hut, and a dirty trail leads 
to the south.

Rooms.Name: The Chasm
Rooms.Description:
You stand before a deep chasm. You can see the fettered ends of an 
old rope bridge cut and hanging into the chasm. To the west is a 
dirty trail, and the cut rope bridge leads down.

Exits.Description: Down the dangling end of the rope bridge

Rooms.Name: Hanging on the Rope Bridge
Rooms.Description:
You are hanging at the tattered end of a rope bridge. Your grip is 
fairly strong. You can either try to swing east across the chasm to 
the other loose part of the bridge, or you can climb up and out, or 
you can let go into the yawning depths of the chasm.

Rooms.Name: Hanging on the Rope Bridge
Rooms.Description:
You are hanging on the frayed end of the rope bridge. You can either 
attempt to swing to the east side, climb up the bridge, or go down 
into the yawning depths of the chasm.

Rooms.Name: The Chasm
Rooms.Description:
You stand at the brink of a deep chasm. The rope bridge across it has 
been cut by some vile villian and lies hanging down into the chasm. 
You can either climb down the bridge into the chasm or head to the 
green field to the east.

Rooms.Name: Inside the Inviting Hut
Rooms.Description:
You are inside an inviting hut. Around you is the comfortable interior, 
complete with feather bed and fireplace. A table of fresh meat and 
vegatables has been set, and on it is an ornate chalice filled with 
wine. A candle burns brightly and there is a single chair at the table.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: Why don't you sit down for a while and have a nice meal?

Its a black candle. What was that you remember about black candles? 
Oh yeah, they are used by witches in black masses.
The meat is juicy, the wine has a nice dry aroma and a deep red color.
The bed looks comfortable. Inviting.
On closer inspection the chalice is not the holy grail.

Rooms.Name: The Yawning Depths
Rooms.Description:
Blue...NO GREEN!
   AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH
       AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH
           AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH
SPLAAAAT.

Rooms.Name: The Green Field Before Camelot
Rooms.Description:
You stand under the open sky in the emerald green field before Camelot.
Camelot lies ontop of a hill overlooking the field. Flags and banners 
snap in the fresh breeze from the proud towers of Camelot. You can either 
head east to Camelot or west to the chasm.

Rooms.Name: The Western Gate of Camelot
Rooms.Description:
You stand at the gates to Camelot. You have a commanding view of the emerald 
plane below. White granite walls rise impressively into the air.

Rooms.Name: Bailey of Blackmoor
Rooms.Description:
You stand inside the bailey of Blackmoor. Murder holes line the walls and 
towers rise ahead. To the north and south are black iron gates.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: Nobody seems to be looking at you through the murder holes

Rooms.Name: Inside the Curtain Wall
Rooms.Description:
You stand on a road inside the Curtain Wall of Blackmoor. The keep proper 
is to your north. The road continues to the east and west, and a black iron 
gate is to the south.

Rooms.Name: Inside the Curtain Wall
Rooms.Description:
You stand on the road inside the curtain wall of Blackmoor. Stairs lead up 
to the eastern bailey tower and the road continues to the north and west.

Rooms.Name: Inside the Curtain Wall
Rooms.Description:
You stand on the road inside the curtain wall. Stairs lead up to the western 
bailey tower, and the road continues north and east.

Rooms.Name: Inside the Curtain Wall
Rooms.Description:
You stand on a road inside the curtain wall of Blackmoor. The keep proper 
is to the east of you. The bloody road continues north and south.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
You bend down and look at the blood in the road and find a piece of silk. 
You examine it and notice that it appears to be a favor of a lady in waiting 
of Camelot.

Rooms.Name: Inside the Curtain Wall
Rooms.Description:
You stand on a road inside the curtain wall of Blackmoor. Stairs lead up to 
the northwestern tower of blackmoor. The road continues to the south, and 
to the east where the entrance to the keep proper is.

Rooms.Name: Entrance to the Keep Proper
Rooms.Description:
You stand on a road inside the curtain wall of Blackmoor. To the south is 
a massive wooden door, from which you hear elfin laughter. The road 
continues to the east and west.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: Its huge! Hope you don't get a hernia opening it.

Rooms.Name: Inside the Curtain Wall
Rooms.Description:
You stand on a road inside the curtain wall of Blackmoor. Stairs lead up 
to the northeastern tower of Blackmoor. The road continues to the south 
and west, where the entrance to the keep proper is located.

Rooms.Name: Inside the Curtain Wall
Rooms.Description:
You stand on a road inside the curtain wall of Blackmoor. To the west 
looms the keep proper. The road continues north and south.

Rooms.Name: The Northwest Tower of Blackmoor
Rooms.Description:
You stand inside the northwestern tower. You have a commanding view of 
the keep and the moor itself. Stairs lead downward.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
You look at the view. The moor rolls onward, and mist makes it difficult 
to  see very far. You see black forms scuttling across the moor. For a 
moment you are glad you are in a solid tower.

Rooms.Name: The Northeastern Tower of Blackmoor
Rooms.Description:
You stand inside the northeastern tower. You have a commanding view of 
the keep and the surrounding moor. Stairs lead down.

Rooms.Name: West Bailey Tower
Rooms.Description:
You stand inside the western bailey tower. You have a great view of the 
bailey and you could fire a ranged weapon through the murder hole. Stairs 
lead down.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: You peek through the murder hole at the bailey as many have done before you.

Rooms.Name: East Bailey Tower
Rooms.Description:
You stand inside the eastern bailey tower. You have a commanding view of 
the bailey and could fire uncontested through the murder hole. Stairs lead 
down.

Rooms.Name: The Dark Hall of Mordred
Rooms.Description:
You stand in the foul hall of Mordred. Smoke writhes upward to the rafters 
from a firepit in the center. Armor from defeated knights is hung from 
hooks on the wall. Knights sit in a circle about the fire staring woodenly 
into the flames. A young elvin lad in golden armor laughs as he weaves a 
dance amongst them.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
You shake your head and look a second time. The lad disappears. A foul 
spell has hold of you!
You examine the fire pit. A large body is roasting here. It looks human!

Rooms.Name: Victory Road and Knights Way
Rooms.Description:
You stand on a marbled road inside the great walls of Camelot. Pinnons 
fly from high towers and the buildings gleam of white stone. Victory Road 
contiues east into the keep, and Knights Way runs north and south.

Rooms.Name: Knights Way before the stables
Rooms.Description:
You stand on the white marbled road, Knights Way. You smell horses to 
the east. To the west the high walls of camelot rise. Knights way continues 
to the north and south.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
The high walls tower above you, made from a gleaming white stone. The 
blocks are huge- it must have taken a great engine to hoist them. Pennons 
snap in  the breeze from the many towers of Camelot.
There are many horses and squires scurring about in the stables.

Rooms.Name: Victory Road
Rooms.Description:
You stand on victory road. Knights pennons are stuck in the ground on 
both sides of the road, with their coat of arms flapping in the breeze. 
There are available slots for other coats of arms. Victory road continues 
to the east and west.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
You look at the coats of arms. You recognize a few of the devices as that 
of Gawaine, Tristram, and of course Lancelot.

Rooms.Name: Knights Way at the Armory
Rooms.Description:
You stand on the white marbled Knights Way. To your west the towering 
walls of Camelot rise, and to the east is the armory of Camelot. Knights 
Way continues north and south.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
The high walls tower above you, made from a gleaming white stone. The 
blocks are huge- it must have taken a great engine to hoist them. Pennons 
snap in  the breeze from the many towers of Camelot.

Rooms.Name: Corner of Knight's Way and Squire's Run
Rooms.Description:
You stand at the corner of Knight's way and Squire's run. An arched 
doorway rises up into a stalwart tower. You can see lettering above the 
arch.  Knight's way continues south, and Squire's Run heads east.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
You look at the engraved words:

    FORWARD TO VICTORY

Rooms.Name: Behind the Pict Lines
Rooms.Description:
You have battled your way through the ranks of the Picts, and your 
salley has placed you behind the Pict lines! To the east the battle 
rages, and you see fleeing Picts headed this way.  A barbarian is winding 
a horn with the recall signal.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: The barbarian sees you looking at you, and flees in terror!

Rooms.Name: Victory Road
Rooms.Description:
Here Victory Road ends at the great Tourney Yard of Camelot. A podium 
for tourney winners is erected here- today it bears the coat of arms 
of Lancelot. Flanking the road are the standards of the other knights 
of the round table. A strange peace fills the air here. Victory road 
continues to the west, and the Tourney Yard of Camelot is to the east.

Rooms.Name: Armory
Rooms.Description:
You stand in the Armory of Camelot. The master blacksmith and his 3 
apprentices are busy fabricating a suit of armor for a knight. Various 
pieces of armor are here in varying states of repair. There is a large  
weapons rack on the eastern wall. To the west is Knight's Way.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: The weapons rack contains several daggers, a few lances, and some maces.
The armor pieces are made from fine hammered steel.

Rooms.Name: Corner of Knight's Way and Noble Road
Rooms.Description:
You stand at the corner of Knights Way and Noble Road. A tower rises up 
from here by a winding staircase. There is an inscription above the archway 
to the tower. Knights way continues north and Noble Road goes east.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
You look at the inscription. It reads:

       HONOR SEPERATES THE KNIGHT FROM THE CRIMINAL

Rooms.Name: Squire's Run
Rooms.Description:
You stand on Squire's Run. Squires bustle up and down the road on various 
errands for their lords. You notice a scroll lying on the ground. Squire's
Run contines east and west.

Exits.Description: Corner of Knight's Way and Squire's Run

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
You look at the scroll. It is torn and badly smeared. You can make out:

  .... I wandered through the Forest of Blackmoor, lost and without hope, 
  until I found a hut. I looked through the window and there stood the  
  Grail on a table. A beautiful woman beckoned to me, and at that moment 
  my mount spooked, racing into the forest.....

Rooms.Name: Tower of Valor
Rooms.Description:
You stand in the tower of valor. The walls bear murals of battle scenes, 
of knights fighting knights and various unearthly beasts. There is a hollow 
in one of the walls in which a fire takes the edge off the cold of the room. 
The smoke puts you in a strange daze in which the MURALS seem to come to 
life. Stairs lead down to the street below.

Exits.Description: Corner of Knight's Way and Squire's Run

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
You look at a mural of Saint George and the Dragon. George's armor gleams 
in the sun, and from his lance flies his standard. George signals the 
dragon and charges across the verdant green. The dragon raises its 
serpentine head and inhales a mighty breath. George and mount thunder 
though the tall grass. The dragon-
             You snap out of your vision

Rooms.Name: Tourney Yard of Camelot
Rooms.Description:
You stand in the reknowned tourney yard of Camelot. Here knights challenge 
one and another for a claim to a seat on the round table. You can make out 
several contests underway- perhaps you would like to joust?

Rooms.Name: Tower of Honor
Rooms.Description:
You stand in the tower of honor. MURALS cover the walls and domed ceiling.
Smoke rolls out in an erie caress from the fire hollow in the walls. A 
strange tingling sensation rushes through your body. Stairs lead to the 
street below.

Exits.Description: Corner of Knight's Way and Noble Road

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
You look at the mural of Lancelot, Gwenivere, and Arthur on a picnic. A 
page arrives and hands Arthur a scroll. Arthur reads the scroll and mounts 
his charger, racing back along the road. Lancelot turns to mount his 
charger, but a feminine hand restrains him, beckoning to the cool shade 
under the oaks. Lancelot turns to face Gwenivere-
      You snap out of your vision

Rooms.Name: Noble Road
Rooms.Description:
You stand on Noble Road. The street is paved in yellow stone, giving the 
impression of gold in the wet sections. A statue of Uther Pendragon is 
here. The road continues east and west.

Exits.Description: Corner of Knight's Way and Noble Road

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
You look at the statue. Uther Pendragon wears chain mail and bears a 
giant axe. His beard flows along his lines, and his eyes bore into you 
with an uneasy intensity.

Rooms.Name: Squire's Run at the North Gate
Rooms.Description:
You stand on Squire's run. A steady stream of traffic is coming and going 
to the south, where the squire's barracks is. To the north is the Great 
Northern Gate of Camelot. Squire's run continues to the west, and the 
Tourney Yard of Camelot is to the west. At your feet sits a beggar holding 
a cup.

Exits.Description: The Great Northern Gate of Camelot

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
You toss a coin to the beggar. He smiles at you and whispers "Beware of 
Sir Garlon, the Invisible Knight in the area outside the west gate". 
With a groan and a grovel the beggar shuffles off to the discard pile.

Rooms.Name: The Great Northern Gate of Camelot
Rooms.Description:
You stand before the great northern gate of Camelot. A dirt road winds 
down the hill upon which Camelot rests into the rolling grass hills of 
the north. To the south is Squire's Run.

Rooms.Name: Squire's Barracks
Rooms.Description:
You stand in the squire's barracks. It is here that all of the lackeys 
of the knights of the round table reside while their lords are in court. 
The place is a jumble of beds, lockers, and tables. Activity swirls 
around the long wooden benches and tables where at present people are 
eating. There is a rudimentry camp kitchin, with a roster of the day 
(your name is not on it).

Exits.Description: Squire's Run at the North Gate

Rooms.Name: Tourney Yard of Camelot
Rooms.Description:
You stand in the reknowned tourney yard of Camelot. Here knights challenge 
one and another for a claim to a seat on the round table. You can make out 
several contests underway- perhaps you would like to joust?

Rooms.Name: Tourney Yard of Camelot
Rooms.Description:
You stand in the reknowned tourney yard of Camelot. Here knights challenge 
one and another for a claim to a seat on the round table. You can make out 
several contests underway- perhaps you would like to joust?

Exits.Description: You see the Court of Camelot

Rooms.Name: Tourney Yard of Camelot
Rooms.Description:
You stand in the reknowned tourney yard of Camelot. Here knights challenge 
one and another for a claim to a seat on the round table. You can make out 
several contests underway- perhaps you would like to joust?

Rooms.Name: Noble Road at the South Gate
Rooms.Description:
You stand at on Noble road at the Great Southern Gate of Camelot. To the 
north lies the Noble quarters, where visiting nobility reside. The 
tournament yard is to the east and Noble Road continues west. There is a 
statue here of a knight.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
Here stands our rememberance of Miles O' the Lands, knight of quality, of 
the Round Table. He fought valiantly defending the queen in the Battleplain 
of Arden.

The statue is of a mounted knight, riding forth to the southern gate. He 
bears a pennon in one hand, a lance in the other, and wears full armor. 
The horse which he rides rears in the air, signifying death in combat. 
There is a small inscription here.

Rooms.Name: Tourney Yard of Camelot
Rooms.Description:
You stand in the reknowned tourney yard of Camelot. Here knights challenge 
one and another for a claim to a seat on the round table. You can make out 
several contests underway- perhaps you would like to joust?

Exits.Description: Squire's Run at the North Gate

Rooms.Name: Tourney Yard of Camelot
Rooms.Description:
You stand in the reknowned tourney yard of Camelot. Here knights challenge 
one and another for a claim to a seat on the round table. You can make out 
several contests underway- perhaps you would like to joust?

Rooms.Name: Tourney Yard of Camelot
Rooms.Description:
You stand in the reknowned tourney yard of Camelot. Here knights challenge 
one and another for a claim to a seat on the round table. You can make out 
several contests underway- perhaps you would like to joust?

Exits.Description: Noble Run at the South Gate

Rooms.Name: Tourney Yard of Camelot
Rooms.Description:
You stand in the reknowned tourney yard of Camelot. Here knights challenge 
one and another for a claim to a seat on the round table. You can make out 
several contests underway- perhaps you would like to joust?

Rooms.Name: Noble's Quarters
Rooms.Description:
You are inside the quarters in which visiting nobleman reside.
There is a courtyard with a fountain where you stand, and there are several 
individual chambers shooting off of the courtyard.

Exits.Description: Noble Road at the South Gate

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
The statue depicts a girl in a tunic-like dress. She is chubby and has 
shoulder length hair.

You really dont want to bother getting the coins out. It would be in poor 
taste.
The fish are small minnow like fish, mostly bottom feeders.

The fountain has has flowing water from a statue of a girl holding an urn.
The water drops into a tile lined pool, where fish swim. Some coins have 
been tossed in the fountain.

Rooms.Name: The Great Southern Gate
Rooms.Description:
You stand before the great southern gate of Camelot. Southwards a cobbled 
road winds through fertile cultivated plains. Serfs are tilling the field 
with horse drawn ploughs. Corn, wheat, and beans are growing. Your vantage 
is fantastic, and the breeze clears your nose of the city smells.

Rooms.Name: Tourney Yard of Camelot
Rooms.Description:
You stand in the reknowned tourney yard of Camelot. Here knights challenge 
one and another for a claim to a seat on the round table. You can make out 
several contests underway- perhaps you would like to joust?

Rooms.Name: Tourney Yard of Camelot
Rooms.Description:
You stand in the reknowned tourney yard of Camelot. Here knights challenge
one and another for a claim to a seat on the round table. You can make out
several contests underway- perhaps you would like to joust?

Rooms.Name: The Court of Camelot
Rooms.Description:
You stand in the fabled court of Camelot. Here in the sunny courtyard noblemen
and knights walk barefoot in the grass discussing chivalry and wars to come.
Troubadours play ballads on their lutes and entertainers hop and leap into the
air all for a chance of earning the kings favor. Ladies in waiting play their
love games with young knights and squires. The whole world seems like a much
better place here, where friendship thrives and the high ideals of chivalry
breathe.  You have a commanding vantage of the Tourney Yard of Camelot from
here.  Exits lead to the knights barracks, the round table, the feast hall,
and the tourney yard of Camelot.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
The lady in waiting is weeping, as her knight was the orange knight. She
quickly recovers and tosses her favor to the black knight.

You watch two knights across the tourney yard. To the left is a knight
in full armor and a bright orange plume. To the right is a knight in chain 
mail and a trailing black cape. Arthur signal's the knights with a short wave.
The both knights spur their warhorses into a full gallop. To your right you
hear a squeal of delight from a spectator. The black caped knight leans into
his charge with his weight forward and in a low stand on his stirrups. 
Both knights collide in the center of the yard with a resounding crash. The
orange plummed knight contorts in his saddle, delivering a thrust high on 
the shield of the black caped knight. The black caped knight connects with a
hard shot to the center of the shield of the orange knight. You watch the 
orange knight fly and land with a sickening crash on the yard. The black
knight circles and raises his lance in a salute to Arthur.

Rooms.Name: The Feast Hall
Rooms.Description:
You have arrived in the feast hall of Camelot. You are in luck. A feast is 
in progress. There are many open bench type tables with sevants scurrying 
too and fro. Some tables hold knights, while others have ladies. A bards 
song adds to the festive air of celebration. A huge fire rages in a great 
stone hearth, over which a whole boar is being slowly cooked to perfection. 
Exits are north to the court of Camelot, and south to the ladies' chambers.

Exits.Description: You see the Court of Camelot

Rooms.Name: The Ladies' Chambers
Rooms.Description:
You are in the ladies' chambers. I hope you are a lady, for you are in big 
trouble if you are not! There are many many rooms here, some occupied, some 
not, but there certainly is a lot of activity. A young girl stands in sorrow 
here weeping, and you notice a group of ladies off in the corner. There is 
a door north of here leading to the feast hall, and a staircase winding up 
to a tower.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
You perk up your ears and listen in on the group of ladies. You overhear :
"...it is terrible. The poor girl was captured on her way to her wedding 
by that foul Mordred. Her father has offered a considerable sum for her 
safe return. I think my Gawaine can surely claim it...."

You talk to the girl. She is upset because Lancelot wont pay attention to 
her.

Rooms.Name: The Maiden's Tower
Rooms.Description:
Oh yes, it is here that the virginal maidens of the court reside, pining 
away for their knights who travel far and wide on Arthurs missions. The 
main activity here is tapestry making, and presently there are 3 tapestries 
under construction.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
Two of the tapestries are finished enough to recognize. One depicts a 
battle between knights and the other is of a hunt in the Forest Arden.

Rooms.Name: Knight's Barracks
Rooms.Description:
You have entered the knights barracks. Cots and armor stands fill the room.
Some knights are here sleeping and healing from their war wounds. A simple 
wash stand is at the end of the quarters, and the windows are shaded to 
darken the room. The only conversation is in hushed tones. There is a door 
leading south to the court of Camelot, and a staircase winds its way upwards 
to a tower.

Exits.Description: You see the Court of Camelot

Rooms.Name: Merlin's Tower
Rooms.Description:
You have found Merlin's tower. It is a jumbled mess of books, scrolls, 
wands, staves, etc. There are rickety worn out tables and chairs upon 
which a variety of curiosities rest. Merlin also has several animals 
and specimens of this and that in crocks on wooden shelves. You take a 
glimpse out the open window of Merlin's tower and see the rolling hills 
of Camelot as far as you gaze. But most of all you notice the large 
pulsating pentagram in the center of the room which throbs and humms 
in time to your heartbeat. There is also a SIGN here with unearthly 
glowing red lettering which blinks over and over the message "LOOK AT ME"

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
Your inner coice, which has always served you well so far, screams at you 
to LEAVE IT ALONE!

You fumble through Merlins crockery, and all you accomplish is getting a 
black resiny substance which itches all over your fingers and clothing.

You look at the sign. At first you can't understand it, but then the 
lettering adjusts to a language you understand. It says:
BEWARE OF DEMON! I have imprisoned a FOUL, NASTY, EXTREMELY POWERFUL 
demon in this pentagram. To those inside, there are NO EXITS or WAYS 
TO MAGICALLY RECALL. Even Lancelot would certainly die in the pentagram. 
THERE IS NOTHING OF WORTH IN THE PENTAGRAM, ONLY DEATH, and nothing short 
of DIRECT DIVINE INTERVENTION will get you out of it. - Merlin
Merlin has a crow, a cat, and a toad. All watch your every move.

You sift through Merlin's books, scrolls, wands, and staves. All are 
inscribed in a strange runic language which you can't even begin to fathom.

Rooms.Name: The Round Table
Rooms.Description:
You have entered the Round Table, where warcouncil is held between Arthur 
and his companions. The Round Table is 30' in diameter, and made of polished 
cherry. Around it are 50 chairs. The room which houses the table is also 
round and far above you see the domed ceiling. Light streams down in long 
rays to hit the gold and crystal candelabra, where it is broken into a 
brilliant prismatic spray. A door leads west to the court of Camelot, and 
a staircase winds upward.

Exits.Description: You see the Court of Camelot

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
You consider lifting the candelabra but decide against it, as you probably 
would get very tired fast, and attract every knight in the kingdom.

Rooms.Name: Arthur's Chambers
Rooms.Description:
You have entered the private chambers of King Arthur. A dragon banner serves 
as a canopy and curtains for his large four posted bed. He has a marble 
basin and a cherry desk and chair. A huge ermine rug lies on the floor. A 
staircase winds downwards. Tapestries depicting him pulling Excalibur from 
the stone, and his campaigns of unification adorn the walls.

Rooms.Name: Noble's Chambers
Rooms.Description:
You are tresspassing in a Nobles chamber. He negligently forgot to lock his 
door, relying upon the honor of all within Camelot to protect his posessions.
The chambers consist of a common room, several bed chambers, and a servant 
area.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: Nothing here you really need.

Rooms.Name: Noble's Chambers
Rooms.Description:
You are standing in vacated chambers. Perhaps you will stay a while and 
visit the court? The chambers consist of several bed chambers, a sitting 
room, and a small garden.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: Some fresh vegetables and flowers are growing here.

Rooms.Name: Noble's Chambers
Rooms.Description:
You are tresspassing in a Noble's chamber. This noble locked his door, 
anticipating intrusion from scum like you. The chambers consist of a common 
room, several bed chambers, and a servant area.

Rooms.Name: The Pentagram
Rooms.Description:
Well you have done it. You have stepped into the pentagram. You are blasted 
by a hellish heat, and cackling assails you from all sides. Your entire body 
is wracked in pain, and you hear yourself screaming in and endless cry of 
horror. You are stuck here forever!!!!!!

Rooms.Name: The Rolling Hills
Rooms.Description:
You have spent the day travelling a road through the rolling hills north of
Camelot. You have gone through several villages. The people you have met 
are generally a happy lot. You presently stand at a crossroads. To the 
north, the road continues through the rolling hills. To the east the road 
goes into a grassy plain. To the south the road goes to Camelot.

Rooms.Name: The Rolling Hills
Rooms.Description:
You have spent the day travelling a road through the rolling hills north of
Camelot. You have gone through several villages. The people you have met are 
generally a happy lot. To the north, the road winds upwards into the 
highlands. The road continues south into the rolling hills.

Rooms.Name: The Grassy Plains
Rooms.Description:
You spend a week travelling through a great grassy plain. You have crossed 
several baronies in you travels. You have encounterd knights and pilgrims 
on your journey, and slept in many a hayloft and haystack. The farmland is 
productive here, and there have been many horse ranches, in which the fine 
steeds of Camelot are produced. At present you stand in a strange stone 
formation in the vast plain. The road stretches west to the rolling hills, 
and east to the rocky coast.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
The lettering says:

 LACNOGIRANDUTOS ROYU AYLGPIN LILSK SI BLAMMENEDOC

You walk up to the table and examine it. It has rusty brown stains on it-
BLOOD! You examine the ground around the table and find fleece. Obviously 
this is an altar. You can just make out some lettering on the stone.

You look at the stone formation. The stones stand about 15' tall an are 
arranged in a circular series of frames, with two stones stacked on end 
and one laid across the tops of the other two. There is a stone table in 
the center of the formation, upon which the first light of day is striking.

Rooms.Name: The Highlands
Rooms.Description:
You have spent the day travelling in the highlands, and you are very tired.
You stand at an old Wall that runs east and west through the hills. Not 
many trees grow here, as all has been cleared north of the wall. South of 
the wall stretches a winding road. North of the wall is the untamed Scottish 
highlands. There is an outpost to the east.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: The lettering says: HADRIANUS
You look at the wall. There is lettering on it.

Rooms.Name: The Rocky Coast
Rooms.Description:
You have picked your way through the rocky coast. The weather has been 
foul, which has influenced your mood. The road vanished 2 days ago. Now 

you stand on a cliff overlooking the vast ocean. The mist obscures your 
view of the horizon, but you know its there- somewhere. Far below you is 
a rocky beach.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description:
You look at the beach, and you are glad you did. You see smoke coming up 
from the beach and now as you look closer you see the dwellings of a 
barbaric people. The beach is definitly inhabited.

Rooms.Name: The Scottish Highlands
Rooms.Description:
You have spent several days wandering in the Scottish highlands. You have 
spied the lassies tending the sheep, and several bands of wandering Scot 
raiders, which you have sensibly evaded. Up ahead, on the bluff rises a keep.
You are not certain you should go in.

Rooms.Name: An Outpost
Rooms.Description:
You are in the outpost for the wall. It is a stone keep, with little in the 
way of creatur comforts. There are barracks and a main hall. Guards are 
posted along the wall. Your arrival has been a source of great interest, 
as these bordermen don't see many people.

Rooms.Name: The rocky beach
Rooms.Description:
You stand on the rocky beach wishing you had a boat. You had a tough climb 
down through all of those crevices. There are several caves and grottos 
here.

Exits.Description: A tough climb that you would rather not do

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: You look at the caves- smoke! This place is inhabited!
The surf is crashing hard in the grottos. You can taste the salt spray.

Rooms.Name: Scots Keep
Rooms.Description:
You are in the speldor of a Scots keep. Walls are draped with animal hides.
Women and children are sprawled among pallets of skins and hides. A great 
roaring fire blazes in a huge stone hearth, taking the chill from your 
bones. The men were doing a dance involving leaping over swords, but they 
have stopped since you are here. There is a big iron pot warming from a 
chain in the fire.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: The iron pot contains a mix of potatoes, roots, and what appears to be boar.

Rooms.Name: Farms
Rooms.Description:
You have spent a day travelling though the breadbasket of Camelot, following 
a cobble stone road. The fields are producing well this year, and the 
peasants are out harvesting a bountiful crop. Soon the harvest end festivals 
will begin and all will celebrate another fine year. In fact you have 3 
invitations for various festivals from the people you have met along the 
way.

Rooms.Name: Farms
Rooms.Description:
You have spent a day travelling though the breadbasket of Camelot, following 
a cobble stone road. The fields are producing well this year, and the 
peasants are out harvesting a bountiful crop. Soon the harvest end festivals 
will begin and all will celebrate another fine year. Your pleasant mood is 
interrupted by the sight of smoke and the sounds of screams from the south.

Extra_Descr_Data.Description: You can make out the cries of 'To Arms! To Arms! The Angle raiders are here!

Rooms.Name: Farms
Rooms.Description:
You have spent a day travelling though the breadbasket of Camelot, 
following a cobble stone road. The fields are producing well this year, 
and the peasants are out harvesting a bountiful crop. Soon the harvest 
end festivals will begin and all will celebrate another fine year. In fact 
you have 2 invitations for various festivals from the people you have met 
along the way.

Rooms.Name: Farms
Rooms.Description:
You have spent a day travelling though the breadbasket of Camelot, 
following a cobble stone road. This paticular section of farms is not 
doing as well, as signs of raiding and pillaging abound here. The peasants 

seem to be bouncing back, and the fields are once again with crop. To 
the west is a heavily travelled muddy road, and the fields continue to 
the east and north.

Rooms.Name: Angle Raid!
Rooms.Description:
You are in the whirling chaos of an Angle raid on this farming village.
Farmers are defending themselves from the raiders with their farm tools.
Women are gathering the children and running north. Some unlucky women 
are being raped by the brutish Angles, who are so named for the long 
angled polearm they use. The village is on fire, and you can make out 
the raider ship on the shore to the west.

Exits.Description: To where everybody else is fleeing

Rooms.Name: An Outpost
Rooms.Description:
You have reached a fortified outpost. Your boots sink in the mud which 
is rutted and groved by the supply wagons which come her.
You talk to the guards and they warn you of the merciless Picts to the 
west, with whom Camelot is at war. The men are hardened by warfare, and 
stare at you with eyes that have seen terrible atrocity. To the east are 
farms, and to the west you hear the terrible clash of war.

Rooms.Name: Battle!
Rooms.Description:
You have boldly entered the heart of a raging battle between the knights 
of Camelot and the barbaric Picts. The knights have set up a skirmish 
line across the field, spreading out the Picts, while two calvary units 
are sweeping around the ends in a pincher like move. Holding the center 
of the line are several knights of reknown. The Picts are faring badly, 
as their leader has already left the field in cowardly retreat.

Rooms.Name: Stables
Rooms.Description:
You stand in the vast stables of Camelot. Row upon row of stalls greet 
your eye. Smells of horse sweat and fresh straw combine in a pleasant mix. 
Stable hands are busy currying animals, shoeing horses, and feeding the 
magnificant chargers of Camelot. Light filters in through the rafters. 
To your west is Knight's Way.

Rooms.Name: Pet Storage for Stables
Rooms.Description: This is actual stables where the horses are kept to be sold.

Resets.Comment: Load in questing beast in lair
Load in Gawaine in Tourney Yard
Load in Lancelot in Tourney Yard
Lancelot dons his gauntlets of bravery
Load in Tristram in Tourney Yard
Put galahad on return quest in battleplain at war
Turquine, the evil knight, pawn of Mordred, fighting G.
Puts Lamorak in barracks (gawaine kicked his butt today)
Arthur in his court of camelot
Merlin has left his key here
Load damsel in distress in NE tower of Blackmoor
Give damsel the reward for her rescue
Give Barant his ball and chain
Load Gareth in the Tower of Valor
Gareth wears his many colored cloak
Gareth wears his many colored shield
On at junction victory road & knights
One in SE tower of Blackmoor
load a spare pouch in locked room
; The Court of Camelot Close North
; The Court of Camelot Close East
